element.title: Scrollbar
element.longdescription:
Note: Redmond components are deprecated. Please consider using LZ Components. If you use this component, you must explicitly include the redmond library:
<include href="redmond"/>

Arguments:
axis
default: "y"
Axis can be "x" or "y". Axis="y" produces a vertical scrollbar on the right side of the view. Axis="x" produces a horizontal scrollbar at the bottom of the view.


Description:
The scrollbar tag provides a standard scrollbar. Typically a scrollbar and a single view that contains the contents to be scrolled will reside in a single parent view. Note that the parent view of the scroll content view must set clip="true" as in the example below:

Example:

<canvas height="150">
    <include href="redmond"/>

    <view name="main" width="100" height="80" clip="true">
        <view name="contents">
            <text multiline="true">
               1<br/>2<br/>3<br/>4<br/>5<br/>6<br/>7<br/>8<br/>9<br/>10
            </text>
        </view>
        <scrollbar/>
    </view>
</canvas>

attribute.name: stepsize
attribute.desc: The number of pixel that the target is moved when in a single "step," when the user clicks the up or down arrow.

attribute.name: scrolltarget
attribute.desc: a reference to a view to scroll, by default this is the first subview of the scrollbar's parent that is not a scrollbar. If scrolltarget is specified, then scrollbar is not automatically aligned right or bottom.

attribute.name: axis
attribute.desc: "x" for a horizontal scrollbar, "y" for a vertical scrollbar

attribute.name: scrollattr
attribute.desc: By default, 'scrollattr' will be 'x' or 'y' matching the axis of the scrollbar. By providing an alternate attribute name, the scrollbar will modify that attribute of the scrolltarget

attribute.name: scrollmax
attribute.desc: By default, 'scrollmax' is constrained to the size of the scrolltarget. Typically this attribute would only be set when 'scrollattr' is also set. (scrollmin is always zero)
